paper_title.en: Operator means and matrix quadratic equations
Operator functions and the operator harmonic mean

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the American Mathematical Society

paper_title.en: Some results on strongly operator convex functions and operator monotone functions
Positive linear maps on C*-algebras and rigid functions

description.en: Let a linear map Phi between two unital C*-algebras be positive and unital. Kadison showed that if f(t) = vertical bar t vertical bar and Phi(f (X)) = f(Phi(X)) for all selfadjoint operators X, then Phi(X-2) = Phi(X)(2) for all selfadjoint operators X, that is, Phi is a C*-homomorphism. Choi proved this fact for an operator convex function f, and then conjectured that this fact would hold for a non-affine continuous function f. We shall prove a refinement of his conjecture. Petz has further proved that if f(Phi(A)) = Phi(f(A)) for a non-affine operator convex function f and a fixed A, then Phi(A(2)) = Phi(A)(2). Arveson called such a function f a rigid function. We shall directly show power functions t(r) are rigid functions on (0, infinity) if r not equal 0, r not equal 1. (C) 2016 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS AND APPLICATIONS

paper_title.en: Inverses of Operator Convex Functions

description.en: The inverse of an operator convex function is shown to be operator monotone and due to the wide applications of the class of Nevanlinna-Pick functions we formulate a function theoretic version of the results.

paper_title.en: ORDER OF OPERATORS DETERMINED BY OPERATOR MEAN

description.en: Let sigma be an operator mean and f a non-constant operator monotone function on (0, infinity) associated with sigma. If operators A, B satisfy 0 <= A <= B, then it holds that Y sigma (tA + X) <= Y sigma(tB + X) for any non-negative real number t and any positive, invertible operators X, Y. We show that the condition Y sigma(tA + X) <= Y sigma(tB + X) for a sufficiently small t > 0 implies A <= B if and only if X is a positive scalar multiple of Y or the associated operator monotone function f with sigma has the form f(t) = (at + b)/(ct + d), where a, b, c, d are real numbers satisfying ad - bc > 0.

paper_title.en: Superadditivity and derivative of operator functions

description.en: We will show that if Sigma(i not equal j) A(i)A(j) > 0 for bounded operators A(i) >= 0 (i = 1,2, . . . , n), then g(Sigma(i) A(i)) >= Sigma(i) g(A(i)) for every operator convex function g(t) on [0, infinity) with g(0) <= 0; in particular, (Sigma(i) A(i)) log(Sigma(i) A(i)) >= Sigma(i) A(i) log A(i) if each A(i) is invertible. Let A, B >= 0 and A be invertible. Then we will observe that the Frechet derivative Dg(sA) (B) is increasing on 0 < s < infinity for every operator convex function g(t) on (0, infinity) if and only if AB + BA >= 0. (C) 2014 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Operator inequalities: From a general theorem to concrete inequalities

description.en: The aim of this paper is to give a method to extract concrete inequalities from a general theorem, which is established by making use of majorization relation between functions. By this method we can get a lot of inequalities; among others we extend Furuta inequality as follows: Let f(i), g(j) be positive operator monotone functions on [0, infinity) and put k(t) = t(tau 0) f(1)(t)(r1) . . . f(m) (t)(rm), h(t) = t(P0) g(1)(t)(P1), g(n)(t)(pn), where P-0 >= 1 and r(i) >= 0, p(j) >= 0. Then 0 <= A <= C <= B implies, for 0 < alpha < 1+r(0)/p+r(0) with p = p(0) + . . . + p(n), (k(C)(1/2)(A)k(C)(1/2)) alpha <=(k(C)(1/2),(C)k(C)(1/2))(alpha) <= (k(C)(1/2)h(B)k(C)(1/2))(alpha). Moreover, we show log C(1/2)e(A)C(1/2) <= log C(1/2)e(C)C(1/2) <= log C(1/2)e(B)C(1/2), provided C is invertible. We also refer to operator geometric mean. (C) 2014 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: A converse of Loewner-Heinz inequality and applications to operator means

description.en: Let f (t) be an operator monotone function. Then A <= B implies f (A) <= f (B), but the converse implication is not true. Let A # B be the geometric mean of A, B >= 0. If A <= B,then B-1 # A <= I; the converse implication is not true either. We will show that if f (lambda B + I)(-1) # f (lambda A + I) <= I for all sufficiently small lambda > 0, then f (lambda A + I) <= f (lambda B + I) and A <= B. Moreover, we extend it to multi-Variable matrices means. (C) 2013 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS AND APPLICATIONS

paper_title.en: The operator equation Sigma(n)(i=0)A(n-i)XB(i) = Y

description.en: The solution of the linear operator equation: A(n-1) X + A(n-2)XB + ... + AXB(n-2) + XBn-1 = Y is given by X = ((sin pi/n)/pi) integral(infinity)(0)(t + A(n))(-1) Y(t + B-n)(-1)t(1/n) dt if the spectra of A and B are in the sector {z : z not equal 0, -pi/n < arg z < pi/n}. (C) 2009 Elsevier GmbH. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: 作用素単調関数と作用素不等式

paper_title.en: A CONVERSE OF THE LOEWNER-HEINZ INEQUALITY, GEOMETRIC MEAN AND SPECTRAL ORDER

description.en: Let A, B be non-negative bounded self-adjoint operators, and let a be a real number such that 0 < a < 1. The Loewner-Heinz inequality means that A <= B implies that A(a) <= B-a. We show that A <= B if and only if (A + lambda)(a) <= (B + lambda)(a) for every lambda > 0. We then apply this to the geometric mean and spectral order.

publication_name.en: PROCEEDINGS OF THE EDINBURGH MATHEMATICAL SOCIETY

paper_title.ja: Majorization, Operator inequality and Operator mean (Operator monotone functions and related topics)
paper_title.en: Majorization, Operator inequality and Operator mean (Operator monotone functions and related topics)

publication_name.ja: 数理解析研究所講究録

paper_title.en: Some Inequalities for Power Series of Two Operators in Hilbert Spaces

description.en: Some inequalities for functions defined by power series concerning two operators in both the non-commutative and commutative case are given. Natural examples for fundamental functions that can be represented by power series are presented as well.

publisher.en: TOKYO JOURNAL MATHEMATICS EDITORIAL OFFICE ACAD CENTER

paper_title.en: Operator monotone functions, Jacobi operators and orthogonal polynomials

description.en: We reveal a connection between operator monotone functions and orthogonal polynomials. Especially, we express an operator monotone function with a Jacobi operator, and show that it is a limit of rational operator monotone functions. Further we prove that the 'principal inverse' of an orthogonal polynomial is operator monotone and hence it has a holomorphic extension to the open upper half plane, namely a Pick function (or Nevanlinna function). © 2012 Elsevier Ltd.

publication_name.en: Journal of Mathematical Analysis and Applications

paper_title.en: Inequality between unitary orbits

description.en: For bounded self-adjoint operators A and B we write A <= B if there is a unitary U such that A <= U* BU. In [7], Kosaki (1992) has shown that A <=, B =t exp(A) < exp(B). In this note, we extend this; especially, we show that for a function f(t) = Sigma(n)(i=1)C(i)t(a1). e(bit) with positive coefficients a(i), b(i) and c(i), 0 <= A <= B f (A) <= f (B). We then apply this to a positive linear map and get a similar inequality. (C) 2013 Published by Elsevier Masson SAS on behalf of Academie des sciences.

paper_title.en: A normal family of operator monotone functions

description.en: We show that the family of all operator monotone functions f on (-1,1) such that f(0)=0 and f'(0)=1 is a normal family and investigate some properties of odd operator monotone functions. We also characterize the odd operator monotone functions and even operator convex functions on (-1,1). As a consequence, we show that if f is an odd operator monotone function on (-1,1), then f is concave on (-1,0) and convex on (0,1).

paper_title.en: OPERATOR MONOTONE FUNCTIONS, POSITIVE DEFINITE KERNELS AND MAJORIZATION

description.en: Let f(t) be a real continuous function on an interval, and consider the operator function f(X) defined for Hermitian operators X. We will show that if f (X) is increasing w.r.t. the operator order, then for F(t) = integral f(t)dt the operator function F(X) is convex. Let h(t) and g(t) be C(1) functions defined on an interval I. Suppose h(t) is non-decreasing and g(t) is increasing. Then we will define the continuous kernel function K(h, g) by K(h, g)(t, s) = (h(t) - h(s))/(g(t) - g(s)), which is a generalization of the Lowner kernel function. We will see that it is positive definite if and only if h(A) <= h(B) whenever g(A) <= g(B) for Hermitian operators A, B, and we give a method to construct a large number of infinitely divisible kernel functions.

publication_name.en: PROCEEDINGS OF THE AMERICAN MATHEMATICAL SOCIETY

paper_title.en: Majorization and some operator monotone functions

description.en: Let h(t) be a non-decreasing function on l and k(t) an increasing function on J. Then h is said to be majorized by k if k(A) <= k(B) implies h(A) <= h(B). f(t) is operator monotone, by definition, if f(t) is majorized by t. By making use of this rnaJorizat ion we will show that (t-a)(t- b)/(t(r)-a(r))(t(l-r)-b(l-)) is operator monotone on |0, infinity) for 0 <= a, b < infinity and for 0 <= r <= 1; the special case of a = b = 1 is the theorem due to Petz-Hasegawa. (C) 2008 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: A new majorization induced by matrix order

paper_title.en: A New Majorization Induced by Matrix Order, Operator Theory
A new majorization between functions, polynomials, and operator inequalities II

description.en: Let P(I) be the set of all operator monotone functions defined on an interval I, and put P+(I) = {h is an element of P(I): h(t) >= 0, h not equal 0} and P-+(-1)(I) = {h: h is increasing on I, h(-1) is an element of P+(0, infinity)}. We will introduce a new set LP+(I)= {h: h(t) > 0 on I, log h is an element of P(I)} and show LP+(I) . P-+(-1) (I) subset of P-+(-1)(I) for every right open interval I. By making use of this result, we will establish an operator inequality that generalizes simultaneously two well known operator inequalities. We will also show that if p(t) is a real polynomial with a positive leading coefficient such that p(0) = 0 and the other zeros of p are all in {z: Rz <= 0} and if q(t) is an arbitrary factor of p(t), then p(A)(2) <= p(B)(2) for A, B >= 0 implies A(2) <= B-2 and q(A)(2) <= q(B)(2).

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE MATHEMATICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: A matrix subadditivity inequality for f (A+B) and f(A)+f(B)

description.en:
In 1999 Ando and Zhan proved a subadditivity inequality for operator concave functions. We extend it to all concave functions: Given positive semidefinite matrices A, B and a non-negative concave function f on vertical bar 0, infinity),
parallel to f(A + B)parallel to <= parallel to f(A) + f(B)parallel to
for all symmetric norms (in particular for all Schatten p-norms). The case f(t) = root t is connected to some block-matrix inequalities, for instance the operator norm inequality
[GRAPHICS]
for any partitioned Hermitian matrix. (C) 2007 Published by Elsevier Inc.

paper_title.en: Subadditivity of eigenvalue sums

description.en:
Let f(t) be a nonnegative concave function on 0 ≤ t &lt
 ∞ with f(0) = 0, and let X, Y be n×n matrices. Then it is known that ||f(|X+Y|)||1≤ ||f(|x|)||1 + ||f(|Y|)||1, where || · ||1 is the trace norm. We extend this result to all unitarily invariant norms and prove some inequalities of eigenvalue sums. ©2005 American Mathematical Society.

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the American Mathematical Society

paper_title.en: A new majorization between functions, polynomials, and operator inequalities

description.en: Let P+ be the set of all non-negative operator monotone functions defined on [0, infinity), and put P-+(-1) = (h : h(-1) is an element of P+). Then P+ center dot P-+(-1) subset of P-+(-1) and P-+(-1) center dot P-+(-1) subset of P-+(-1). For a function (h) over tilde (t) and a strictly increasing function h we write (h) over tilde <= h if (h) over tilde o h(-1) is operator monotone. If 0 <= (h) over tilde <= h and 0 <= (g) over tilde <= g and if h is an element of P-+(-1) and g is an element of P-+(-1) boolean OR P+, then (h) over tilde h (g) over tilde <= h g. We will apply this result to polynomials and operator inequalities. Let {a(i)}(i=1)(n) and {b(i)}(i=1)(n), be non-increasing sequences, and put u(+) (t) = Pi(i=1)(n)(t - a(i)) for t >= a(1) and v+ (t) = Pi(j=1)(m) (t - b(j)) for t >= b(1). Then v(+) <= u(+) if m <= n and Sigma(i=1)(k)b(i)<= Sigma(i=1)(k) a(i) (1 <= k <= m): in particular, for a sequence {p(n)}(n=o)(infinity) of orthonormal polynomials, (p(n-1))+ <= (p(n))(+). Suppose 0 <r, p and s = 0 or 1 <= s <= 1 + p/r. Then 0 <= A <= B implies (e rA/2 A(s)e(pA) e rA/2)(alpha) <= (e rA/2 B(s)e(pB)e rA/2)(alpha) for 0 < alpha <= r/(p + r). (C) 2005 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: OPERATOR MONOTONE FUNCTIONS AND OPEARTOR INEQUALITIES

paper_title.en: Subadditivity of eigenvalue sums
Operator monotone functions and operator inequalities
Construction of operator monotone functions
On Schwarz type inequalities

description.en: We show Schwarz type inequalities and consider their converses. A continuous function f : [0, ∞) → [0, ∞) is said to be semi-operator monotone on (a, b) if {f(t1/2)}2 is operator monotone on (a2,b2). Let T be a bounded linear operator on a complex Hilbert space ℋ and T = U|T| be the polar decomposition of T. Let 0 ≤ A, B ∈ B(ℋ) and ∥Tx∥ ≤ ∥Ax∥, ∥T*y∥ ≤ ∥By∥ for x, y ∈ ℋ. (1) If a non-zero function f is semi-operator monotone on (0, ∞), then |〈Tx, y〉| ≤ ∥f(A)x∥ ∥g(B)y∥ for x, y ∈ ℋ, where g(t) = t/f(t). (2) If f, g are semi-operator monotone on (0, ∞), then |〈U f (|T|)g(|T|)x, y〉| ≤ ∥f(A)x∥ ∥g(B)y∥ for x, y ∈ ℋ. Also, we show converses of these inequalities, which imply that semi-operator monotonicity is necessary.

research_project_title.ja: 作用素関数の研究と多項式・作用素摂動への応用
research_project_title.en: The study of operator monotone functions and its application to polynomials and operator perturbation

offer_organization.en: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science

description.ja:
Jacobi 作用素のレゾルベントを単位ベクトルに作用させたベクトル関数と単位ベクトルとの内積は作用素単調関数になることは既知である。逆に全ての作用素単調関数をこのように内積表示できることを証明した。
次に、Loewner-Heinz 不等式と呼ばれる命題の逆命題が成立するための条件を恒等作用素の摂動を用いて与えた。この結果についての論文は Proceeding of the Edinburgh Math. Soc. から出版された。そしてこの結果に関連した2編の論文が共著論文として出版された。更に，作用素環における正値線形写像に関する Choi conjecture を肯定的に証明した。
description.en:
It is known that an inner product of a unit vector and a vector function which is a transformation of the unit vector by the resolvent of a Jacobi operator is an operator monotone function. We had conversely proved that every operator monotone function is represented by using inner product.
We next gave a condition under which the converse of the Loewner-Heinz inequality holds using the perturbation of the identity operator. The paper on this result was published from Proceeding of the Edinburgh Math. Soc. Two relevant papers to this result were published as joint works. Further we have proved the Choi conjecture on positive linear maps on C*-algebras.

research_project_title.ja: ヒルベルト空間上の有界線型作用素の不変部分空間
ヒルベルト空間上の非正規有界線型作用素の性質をスペクトル分解を中心に研究する
作用素関数・行列関数の研究と応用
